label: FIGURE 1
caption:
Extra ocular sebaceous adenocarcinoma: exophytic, voluminous, irregular tumoral
lesion, with an infiltrated base and exulcerated areas presenting with hematic
crusts on the surface. The lesion is located on the right mandibular area of an
HIV-positive patient.

label: FIGURE 2
caption:
Sebaceous adenocarcinoma: poorly delimitated lobules formed by stacks of basaloid
cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm, centered by a population of cells with micro
vacuolated cytoplasm, and hyperchromic, irregular nuclei. (HE 20X)

label: FIGURE 3
caption: Sebaceous adenocarcinoma: presence of mitotic figures (HE 40x)

label: FIGURE 4
caption:
Sebaceous adenocarcinoma: immunohistochemistry study showing positivity for
epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) on micro vacuolated cells

label: Fig. 1
caption: Left: gross picture of the sebaceous carcinoma of the back. Right: histology confirming sebaceous carcinoma with free margins.

label: Fig. 2
caption: Left: CT of the abdomen demonstrating a 9-cm mass in the ascending colon. Right: irregular wall thickening and heterogeneity in the rectum (arrow).

label: Fig. 3
caption: Histology demonstrating microsatellite instability in MSH2 and MSH6.

label: Figure 1
caption: Gross appearance of the specimen after fixation and sampling. Note that most of the internal surface is lined by a smooth surface and in the center of the picture an excrescent and irregular lesion arises, which represents the sebaceous carcinoma.

label: Figure 2
caption: Photomicrographs of the tumor - A – Lobular arrangement of the neoplasm, and absence of capsular invasion (H&E, 40X). B – Groups of cells with vacuolated cytoplasm (H&E, 100X).

label: Figure 3
caption: Photomicrographs of the tumor showing nuclear crowding, irregular nuclei with prominent nucleoli and a mitotic figure (H&E 400X).

label: Fig. 1
caption: A: Pre-operative Image showing large ulcerated, multi-lobulated and mushrooming tumour.

label: Fig. 2
caption: A: PA view showing multi-lobulated homogenous soft tissue density in the upper mediastinum, which extends to the right hemithorax. The rest of mediastinal structures look normal. B: lateral view showing multi-lobulated soft tissue homogenous overlying anterior chest wall. Opacity extends from thoracic inlet to superior part of gladiolus with suspicious intrathoracic extension via thoracic inlet.

label: Fig. 3
caption: A: Axial view of non-contrast CT-scan showing a tumour with calcified capsule and with no evidence of bony erosion. B: Axial view of a contrast CT-scan showing multi-dense tumour with a broad stalk and loss of subcutaneous plane at the insertion of the stalk.

label: Fig. 4
caption: A: T1W axial view showing an expholytic tumour enhanced on contrast, with broad and short stalk attached and invading the right pectoralis major muscle. B: T2W para-sagittal view showing an expholytic tumour that is extending from thoracic inlet to the upper third of the sternal body, with a stalk that invades and attaches to the pectoralis major muscle.

label: Fig. 5
caption: A: Tumour after excision measuring 140 × 180 × 30 mm. B: Tumour was excised with part of the right pectoralis major muscle. C: Skin graft undertaken to close the defect. D: Skin graft with areas of over-granulation. E: Final result with the defect closure.

label: Fig. 6
caption: A: H/E section shows ulcerated skin with an invasive carcinoma with sebaceous differentiation. B: H/E (intermediate view) show basaloid tumour cells with cytological atypia and admixed with foamy/vacuolated cytoplasm in keeping with sebaceous cells.

label: Fig. 1
caption: An erythematous mass on the right cheek.

label: Fig. 2
caption: Enlarged mass with focal ulceration and yellowish discharge, 7 months after the first visit.

label: Fig. 3
caption: Excised mass measuring 5.5×4.5×4.0 cm in size.

label: Fig. 4
caption: Resulting defect after wide excision. Note the preserved facial nerve branch (yellow arrow).

label: Fig. 5
caption: Immediate postoperative appearance showing the defect covered with a transposition flap.

label: Fig. 6
caption: Immediate postoperative appearance showing primary closure of the donor site.

label: Fig. 7
caption: Photomicrograph showing undifferentiated cells and large cells with vesicular and ill defined bubbly cytoplasm (H&E, × 200).

label: Fig. 8
caption: Postoperative 10 months view. The wound was healed well without any complication.

label: Figure 1.
caption: Overall survival curves for patients with skin sebaceous adenocarcinoma between ages 18 and 59 years. (A) Sex, (B) marital status, and (C) age at diagnosis.

label: Figure 2.
caption: Overall survival curves for patients with skin sebaceous adenocarcinoma between ages 18 and 59 years. (A) Tumor size, (B) regional involvement or distant metastasis, and (C) primary cancer history.

label: Figure 3.
caption: Overall survival curves for patients with skin sebaceous adenocarcinoma between ages 18 and 59 years. (A)Radiation therapy, (B) chemotherapy, and (C) surgery on tumors.

label: Figure 1
caption: Preoperative clinical view of the lesion

label: Figure 2
caption: Four years postoperative healed lesion with remaining defect

label: Figure 3
caption: Histopathologic examination of the lesion (a) microscopic view at ×40; (b) Necrotic areas; (c) Atypical mitoses; (d) The immunohistochemical staining for epithelial membrane antigen
